Title: Rail Legal Services
Description: Crown Commercial Service as the Authority put in place a Panel Agreement for Rail Legal Services ('the Panel') for Crown Bodies, the Principal Panel Customer being the Department for Transport and other permitted users identified at VI.3 (and any future successors to these organisations) in England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland ('Panel Customers'). Panel Customers will able to enter into Legal Service Contracts with successful Suppliers for any required services. This Panel Agreement will be for an initial Panel Period of three (3) years, with the option to extend for up to one (1) further period of twelve (12) consecutive months. This procurement related to the legal services which are listed in Schedule 3 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015(PCR) 2015 as a specific service. The procurement was conducted in three (3) stages which was ran consecutively. Full details were available in the Invitation to Tender ('the Invitation').
Attachments: Rail Legal Awarded Suppliers .pdf Redacted Panel Agreement.pdf
Additional Text: Please see attached full list of Successful Supplier and Redacted Panel Agreement.

Title: CHIC Solicitors Framework
Description:
CHIC is a consortium of Registered Providers registered under the Housing & Regeneration Act 2008. It is a registered company incorporated on 25th May 2010 under company number 07266506. It currently has around 40 members, although it should be noted that some of the members are groups of housing providers. Details of all members can be found at: http://www.chicltd.co.uk/

CHIC is acting as a Central Purchasing Body for the purpose of undertaking this procurement exercise and concluding framework agreements with each successful applicant. CHIC is also a member of Re: Allies Works Ltd (“Re:Allies”) (company number 08902601) whose registered office is at Duckworth House, Lancastrian Office Centre, Talbot Road, Old Trafford, Manchester M32 0FP and it is intended that the framework agreements resulting from this procurement will  be accessible to all current and future members of Re:Allies (who are currently CHIC, Efficiency North and Procure Plus Holdings Ltd).

Title: Legal Panel Services Framework
Description:
West Midlands Combined Authority (WMCA) is seeking to establish a framework of legal service suppliers (‘Suppliers’) across three Lots covering the full range of legal services required to assist WMCA in meeting its objectives. Suppliers will be required to demonstrate expertise in all areas in respect of which they are successfully appointed and to keep WMCA and its in-house legal, procurement and governance professionals up to date regarding all developments within relevant areas of law. In
addition, WMCA seeks “value added” propositions from Suppliers covering areas such as training, staff development, secondments, and access to research resources.

This framework opportunity consists of 3 lots:
Lot 1 - Full Service Provision
Lot 2 - Regulatory Advice
Lot 3 - Parliamentary Agents

Bidders can submit tenders for any or all of the Lot(s) above.

Tenders are due back by the closing date of 17:00 on Friday 6th May 2016 and the deadline for clarification questions, via BravoSolution, is 17:00 on Tuesday 3rd May 2016.

It is WMCA’s intention to qualify to each lot up to 4 legal Suppliers (although WMCA reserves the right to qualify a higher or lower number dependent upon the quality of responses)

Note: On Friday 17th June 2016 the West Midlands ITA and Centro/PTE were dissolved. Transport is now led by Transport for West Midlands (TfWM) – the transport arm of the West Midland Combined Authority(www.westmidlandscombinedauthority.org.uk)
Additional Text:
In order to express an interest in this tender opportunity you must first register your organisation details on the Bravo Solution Portal - 

https://wmca.bravosolution.co.uk

Please see the attached Supplier Registration Guide for more details.

Once logged into the portal, please see Current Opportunities and express an interest in 'Project_107 - Legal Services Framework'
